int fibonacci(int n) {
    int[] resolution = {0, 1}; // è§£çš„æ•°ç»„
    if(n < 2) { return resolution[n]; }

    int i = 1;
    int fib1 = 0, fib2 = 1, fib = 0;
    while(i < n) {
        fib = fib1 + fib2;
        fib1 = fib2;
        fib2 = fib;
        i++;
    }

    return fib; // è¾“å‡ºç­”æ¡ˆ
}

int Fibonacci(int n) {

    if(n < 2) { return resolution[n]; }

    int fib1 = 0, fib2 = 1, fib = 0;
    while(i < n) {
    	fib = fib1 + fib2;
    	fib1 = fib2;
    	fib2 = fib;
    	i++;
    }
    
    return fib; // è¾“å‡ºç­”æ¡ˆ
}

void getMinCountsHelper(int total, int[] values, ArrayList<Integer> currentCounts, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> combinations) {
    if (0 == total) { // å¦‚æœä½™é¢ä¸º0ï¼Œè¯´æ˜å½“å‰ç»„åˆæˆç«‹ï¼Œå°†ç»„åˆåŠ å…¥åˆ°å¾…é€‰æ•°ç»„ä¸­
        combinations.add(new ArrayList<Integer>(currentCounts));
        return;
    }

    int valueLength = values.length;
    for (int i = 0;  i < valueLength; i ++) { // éå†æ‰€æœ‰é¢å€¼
        int currentValue = values[i];
        if (currentValue > total) { // å¦‚æœé¢å€¼å¤§äºå½“å‰æ€»é¢ï¼Œç›´æ¥è·³è¿‡
            continue;

        // å¦åˆ™åœ¨å½“å‰é¢å€¼æ•°é‡ç»„åˆä¸Šçš„å¯¹åº”ä½ç½®åŠ 1
        ArrayList<Integer> newCounts = new ArrayList<Integer>(currentCounts);
        newCounts.set(i, newCounts.get(i)+1);
        int rest = total - currentValue;

        getMinCountsHelper(rest, values, newCounts, combinations); // æ±‚è§£å‰©ä½™é¢åº¦æ‰€éœ€ç¡¬å¸æ•°é‡
    }
}

int getMinimumHelper(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> combinations) {
    // å¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰å¯ç”¨ç»„åˆï¼Œè¿”å›-1
    if (0 == combinations.size()) { return -1; }

    int minCount = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
    for (ArrayList<Integer> counts : combinations) {
        int total = 0; // æ±‚å½“å‰ç»„åˆçš„ç¡¬å¸æ€»æ•°
        for (int count : counts) { total += count; }

        // ä¿ç•™æœ€å°çš„
        if (total < minCount) { minCount = total; }
    }

    return minCount;
}

int getMinCountOfCoins() {
    int[] values = { 5, 3 }; // ç¡¬å¸é¢å€¼çš„æ•°ç»„
    int total = 11; // æ€»å€¼

    ArrayList<Integer> initialCounts = new ArrayList<>(Collections.nCopies(values.length, 0)); // åˆå§‹å€¼(0,0)

    ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> coinCombinations = new ArrayList<>(); // å­˜å‚¨æ‰€æœ‰ç»„åˆ
    getMinCountsHelper(total, values, initialCounts, coinCombinations); // æ±‚è§£æ‰€æœ‰ç»„åˆï¼ˆä¸å»é‡ï¼‰
    
    return getMinimumHelper(coinCombinations); // è¾“å‡ºç­”æ¡ˆ
}

è¿™é‡Œç»™å‡ºä¸€ç§è§£å†³æ‹¬å·ç”Ÿæˆçš„è§£æ³•ï¼Œç”¨C++è¯­è¨€æè¿°ï¼Œä¾›å¤§å®¶å‚è€ƒï¼š

class Solution {
public:
vector<string> generateParenthesis(int n) {
std::vector<string> v;
backtrace("", 0, 0, n, v);
return v;
}

void backtrace(std::string cur, int left, int right, int n, std::vector<string>& v) {
if (left + right == 2*n) {
v.push_back(cur);
return;
}

if (left < n) backtrace(cur + "(", left+1, right, n, v);
if (right < left) backtrace(cur + ")", left, right+1, n, v);
}
};

You're confusing the size of the array list with its capacity:

the size is the number of elements in the list;
the capacity is how many elements the list can potentially accommodate without reallocating its internal structures.
When you call new ArrayList<Integer>(10), you are setting the list's initial capacity, not its size. In other words, when constructed in this manner, the array list starts its life empty.

One way to add ten elements to the array list is by using a loop:
initialCounts.add(0);

```java
public List<String> genParenthesis(int n) {
List<String> res = new ArrayList<>();
dfs(0,0,n,"",res);
return res;
}

private void dfs(int l,int r,int n,String s,List<String> res){
if(l == r && l == n){
if(check(s)){
res.add(s);
}
return;
}

if(l < n){
dfs(l+1,r,n,s + "(",res);
}

if(r < n){
dfs(l,r+1,n,s + ")",res);
}
}

private boolean check(String s){
Stack<Character> stack = new Stack<>();
for(char c : s.toCharArray()){
if(c == '(') {
stack.push(c);
continue;
}

if(stack.isEmpty()){
return false;
}
stack.pop();
}
return stack.isEmpty();
}
```

class Solution:
def generateParenthesis(self, n: int) -> [str]:

result = []

leftCount = n
rightCount = n

def recursion(curStr, leftCount, rightCount):
if leftCount == 0 and rightCount == 0:
result.append(curStr)
return
if leftCount > 0:
recursion(curStr + "(", leftCount - 1, rightCount)
if leftCount < rightCount:
recursion(curStr + ")", leftCount, rightCount - 1)

recursion("", leftCount, rightCount)
return result

class Solution {
//æœ€åè¿”å›çš„ç»“æœ
LinkedList<String> returnList = new LinkedList<>();
//ç”¨äºå‚¨å­˜ä¸­é—´è·¯å¾„
StringBuffer path = new StringBuffer();
public List<String> generateParenthesis(int n) {

backTacking(n, 0, 0);
return returnList;
}
/*
leftCount:å·¦æ‹¬å·çš„æ•°ç›®
rightCountï¼šå³æ‹¬å·æ•°ç›®
*/
public void backTacking(int n, int leftCount, int rightCount){
//è¿›è¡Œæ‹¬å·åˆæ³•æ€§æ£€æŸ¥
if(leftCount < rightCount || leftCount > n) return;
//é€’å½’ç»“æŸæ¡ä»¶
if(path.length() == 2*n){
returnList.add(path.toString());
return;
}

//å…¶å®å°±æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªäºŒå‰æ ‘
for(int i = 0; i < 2; i++){
if(i == 1){
path.append('(');
backTacking(n, leftCount + 1, rightCount);
path.deleteCharAt(path.length() - 1);
}else{
path.append(')');
backTacking(n, leftCount, rightCount + 1);
path.deleteCharAt(path.length() - 1);
}
}
}
}

class Solution {
private int[] coins;
private int ans;
public int coinChange(int[] coins, int amount) {
this.coins = coins;
Arrays.sort(this.coins); // å…ˆæ’åº
ans = amount + 1;
dfs(this.coins.length - 1, amount, 0); // ä»ä»·å€¼æœ€å¤§çš„ç¡¬å¸å¼€å§‹æ·±æœ
return ans == (amount + 1) ? -1 : ans;
}

private void dfs(int index, int amount, int cnt) {
if (amount == 0) {
ans = Math.min(ans, cnt);
return;
}
for (int i = index; i >= 0; --i) {
if ((ans - cnt) * coins[index] < amount) break; // å‰ªæ
if (coins[i] <= amount)
dfs(i, amount - coins[i], cnt + 1);
}
}
}

```python
def get_min_count_helper(total, values):
if total == 0:
return 0

value_length = len(values)
min_count = sys.maxsize
for i in range(value_length):
current_value = values[i]
if current_value > total:
continue
rest = total - current_value
rest_count = get_min_count_helper(rest, values)
if rest_count == -1:
continue
total_count = 1 + rest_count
if total_count < min_count:
min_count = total_count
if min_count == sys.maxsize:
return -1

return min_count


def get_min_count_of_coins_advance():
values = [5, 3]
total = 8
return get_min_count_helper(total, values)
```

var generateParenthesis = function (n) {

if (left === 0 && right === 0) {
ret.push(parenthesi)
}
if (left > 0) {
_helper(left - 1, right, parenthesi + '(')
}
if (right > left) {
_helper(left, right - 1, parenthesi + ')')
}
}
_helper(n, n, '')
return ret
};

public class Change {

/**

* 1. æœ‰ç»ˆæ­¢æ¡ä»¶

* @param coins å¸å€¼ç§ç±»æ•°ç»„ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ— åº

private static List<List<Integer>> change(int total, int[] coins) {
//ç»ˆæ­¢æ¡ä»¶ï¼Œä¸”è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªç©ºåˆ—è¡¨
if (total == 0) {
List emptyList = new ArrayList<>();
emptyList.add(new ArrayList<>());
return emptyList;
}

//æ‰€æœ‰è§£çš„é›†åˆ
List<List<Integer>> allResultList = new ArrayList<>();

//å¾ªç¯å¸ç§ï¼Œæ¯ç§å¸ç§éƒ½æœ‰å¯èƒ½æœ‰è§£
for (int coinIdx = 0; coinIdx < coins.length; coinIdx++) {
//è§„æ¨¡é€’å‡
int restTotal = total - coins[coinIdx];
if (restTotal < 0) {
continue;
}

//å­é—®é¢˜çš„è§£ å¯¹åº”restTotalçš„æ‰¾é›¶é—®é¢˜
List<List<Integer>> subResultList = change(restTotal, coins);

for (List<Integer> oneResult : subResultList) {
oneResult.add(coins[coinIdx]);
}

allResultList.addAll(subResultList);
}


return allResultList;
}
}

public List<String> generateParenthesis(int n) {
List<String> res = new ArrayList<>();
dfs(0,0,n,new char[2 * n],res);
return res;
}

private void dfs(int l,int r,int n,char[] s,List<String> res){
//æœ‰æ•ˆçš„()éœ€è¦æˆå¯¹å‡ºç°ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å·¦æ‹¬å·æ•°åŠ å³æ‹¬å·æ•°ç­‰äº2 * næ—¶æ‹¬å·ç”Ÿæˆå®Œæˆ
if(2 * n == l + r){
res.add(String.valueOf(s));
return;
}

//ä¸‹ä¸€è½®å‰è¿›ä¸€ä½ï¼Œä¸”è¦†ç›–æ‰å‰ä¸€è½®èµ°è¿‡åœ°æ–¹ï¼Œæœ‰å›æº¯çš„æ•ˆæœ
if(l < n){
s[l+r] = '(';
dfs(l+1,r,n,s,res);
}

if(r < l){
s[l+r] = ')';
dfs(l,r+1,n,s,res);
}
}

parentheses(num - 1, result, '()' + left , right);
parentheses(num - 1, result, left , '()' + right);

}
